alert.note: Alert for Chippewa; Lac Qui Parle; Swift (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 25 at 12:36AM CDT by NWS Minneapolis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Lac qui Parle, Chippewa and Swift Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1236 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles north of Lake Oliver to 5 miles southwest of Appleton to 5 miles west of Dawson. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Lake Oliver around 1240 AM CDT. Dawson and Appleton around 1245 AM CDT. Milan around 1250 AM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Watson, Montevideo, Benson, Lake Hassel and Maynard. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 12 between mile markers 17 and 54. U.S. Highway 212 between mile markers 7 and 39. U.S. Highway 75 between mile markers 103 and 126. U.S. Highway 59 between mile markers 106 and 153. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM CDT for central and west central Minnesota.
